metadata.name: warp_bridge
metadata.description: Warp Bridge - Universal Cross-Chain Token Bridge

instructions.name: bridge_in
docs: Bridge tokens in (mint wrapped or release native)

accounts.name: recipient
docs: Recipient account - must match sender from source chain (bridge to self)

accounts.name: recipient_token_account
docs: Recipient's token account

accounts.name: token_mint
docs: Token mint

accounts.name: mint_authority
docs: Mint authority PDA (only for wrapped tokens, i.e., when is_native = false)
Derived from local_mint which is the wrapped mint on this chain

accounts.name: vault
docs: Vault for releasing native tokens (only used when is_native = true)

accounts.name: vault_token_account
docs: Vault token account (only for releasing on native chain)

instructions.name: bridge_out
docs: Bridge tokens out (burn wrapped or lock native)
Recipient on destination chain is always the same as sender (bridge to self)
seq = slot * 1000 + ix_index (computed client-side)

accounts.name: outgoing_msg
docs: Outgoing message PDA, seeded by seq (slot * 1000 + ix_index)

accounts.name: sender_token_account
docs: Sender's token account

accounts.name: token_mint
docs: Token mint

accounts.name: vault
docs: Vault for holding locked tokens (only for native tokens)
Created during register_token for native tokens

accounts.name: vault_token_account
docs: Vault token account (only for native tokens)
Created during register_token for native tokens

accounts.name: fee_collector
docs: Fee collector account (receives SOL fees)

accounts.name: fee_collector_token_account
docs: Fee collector token account (receives token fees)
Must match token_registry.fee_collector_ata if token fees are configured
Validation done in handler

instructions.name: claim
docs: Claim delayed whale transfer

accounts.name: claimer
docs: Claimer must be the original sender/recipient

accounts.name: claimer_token_account
docs: Claimer's token account

accounts.name: token_mint
docs: Token mint

accounts.name: mint_authority
docs: Mint authority PDA (only for wrapped tokens, i.e., when is_native = false)

accounts.name: vault
docs: Vault for releasing native tokens (only used when is_native = true)

accounts.name: vault_token_account
docs: Vault token account (only for releasing on native chain)

instructions.name: deregister_token
docs: Admin: Deregister a token (closes TokenRegistryEntry PDA)
Use for removing test tokens or cleaning up before migration.
WARNING: This is irreversible - the symbol becomes available for re-registration.

instructions.name: initialize
docs: Initialize the Warp Bridge

instructions.name: initialize_roles
docs: Initialize the Roles account (admin only)

instructions.name: initialize_vault
docs: Initialize vault for a native token (after registration)

accounts.name: vault_token_account
docs: Vault's token account - ATA owned by Vault PDA

instructions.name: migrate_config
docs: Admin: Migrate Config account to new size

instructions.name: migrate_token_registry
docs: Admin: Migrate TokenRegistryEntry account to new size

instructions.name: pause
docs: Pause the bridge (admin or pauser role)

accounts.name: roles
docs: Roles account (optional - may not exist on older deployments)

accounts.name: authority
docs: Authority - must be admin or have pauser role

instructions.name: register_token
docs: Register a new token

instructions.name: set_fees
docs: Admin: Update SOL fees (legacy)

instructions.name: set_guardians
docs: Admin: Update guardians and threshold

instructions.name: set_role
docs: Set a role (admin only)

instructions.name: set_token_fees
docs: Admin: Set token-based fees for a specific token

instructions.name: set_vault_balance
docs: Admin: Set vault balance (for migration)

instructions.name: set_whale_limits
docs: Admin: Set whale limits for a specific token

instructions.name: transfer_admin
docs: Admin: Transfer admin authority to a new address (e.g., multisig)
CRITICAL: This is irreversible without the new admin's cooperation.
Double-check the new_admin address before calling.

instructions.name: transfer_mint_authority
docs: Admin: Transfer mint authority for a wrapped token to a new address.
This allows migrating a token to a new bridge program.
CRITICAL: This is irreversible - the bridge will no longer be able to mint this token.

accounts.name: mint_authority
docs: The mint authority PDA (current authority)

accounts.name: token_mint
docs: The token mint

accounts.name: new_authority
docs: New mint authority address

instructions.name: unpause
docs: Unpause the bridge (admin only)

instructions.name: update_token_registry
docs: Admin: Update token registry entry

types.name: Config
docs: Global configuration for the Warp Bridge

fields.name: admin
docs: Admin authority (can pause, set guardians, modify fees)

fields.name: paused
docs: Bridge paused flag

fields.name: guardians
docs: Guardian public keys (up to 5)

fields.name: num_guardians
docs: Number of active guardians

fields.name: threshold
docs: Threshold (t-of-n signatures required)

fields.name: out_seq_counter
docs: Outgoing message sequence counter

fields.name: in_seq_counter
docs: Incoming message sequence counter

fields.name: flat_fee_lamports
docs: Flat fee in lamports (charged per bridge operation)

fields.name: percentage_fee_bps
docs: Percentage fee (basis points, e.g., 30 = 0.30%)

fields.name: fee_collector
docs: Fee collector account

fields.name: bump
docs: Bump seed for PDA derivation

fields.name: paused_at
docs: Timestamp when bridge was paused (0 if not paused)

fields.name: paused_by
docs: Pubkey that initiated the pause (zeroed if not paused)

fields.name: pause_reason
docs: Reason for pause

fields.name: _reserved
docs: Reserved space for future fields

types.name: IncomingMsg
docs: Incoming message (tokens arriving on this chain)
Recipient is always the same as sender (bridge to self)

fields.name: source_seq
docs: Sequence number from source chain

fields.name: sender
docs: Sender on source chain (also recipient on this chain)

fields.name: token_mint
docs: Token mint on this chain

fields.name: amount
docs: Amount (in token decimals)

fields.name: source_timestamp
docs: Timestamp of original send

fields.name: executed_timestamp
docs: Timestamp of execution on this chain

fields.name: operation
docs: Operation type: 0 = mint wrapped, 1 = release native

fields.name: processed
docs: Processed flag (prevents replay)

fields.name: bump
docs: Bump seed for PDA derivation

fields.name: claimable_after
docs: Timestamp after which tokens can be claimed (0 = immediate/already released)
Used for whale transfers that require delayed claiming

fields.name: claimed
docs: Whether tokens have been claimed (for delayed transfers)
For immediate transfers, this is set to true on bridge_in

types.name: OutgoingMsg
docs: Outgoing message (tokens leaving this chain)
Recipient on destination chain is always the same as sender (bridge to self)

fields.name: seq
docs: Sequence number (monotonically increasing)

fields.name: sender
docs: Sender on this chain (also recipient on destination chain)

fields.name: token_mint
docs: Token mint on this chain

fields.name: amount
docs: Amount (in token decimals)

fields.name: timestamp
docs: Timestamp

fields.name: fee_paid
docs: Fee paid (in lamports)

fields.name: operation
docs: Operation type: 0 = burn wrapped, 1 = lock native

fields.name: bump
docs: Bump seed for PDA derivation

types.name: PauseReason
docs: Reason for bridge pause - used for observability and UX

types.name: RoleType
docs: Role type for set_role instruction

types.name: Roles
docs: Role-based access control for bridge operations
Separate from Config for easy extensibility
PDA: seeds = [b"roles"]

fields.name: pauser
docs: Can pause/unpause bridge and tokens

fields.name: fee_manager
docs: Can adjust fee parameters (future use)

fields.name: registrar
docs: Can register new tokens (future use)

fields.name: bump
docs: Bump seed for PDA derivation

fields.name: _reserved
docs: Reserved space for future roles

types.name: TokenRegistryEntry
docs: Token registration entry
Each token gets one registry entry PDA per chain
Derived as ["token_registry", local_mint]

fields.name: local_mint
docs: The token mint on this chain

fields.name: decimals
docs: Token decimals

fields.name: is_native
docs: Is this the native chain for this token?
- true: This chain holds the native token, we lock/release from vault
- false: This chain holds the wrapped token, we mint/burn

fields.name: symbol
docs: Token symbol (e.g., "USDC", "WBTC") - used to link tokens across chains

fields.name: paused
docs: Paused flag (can be set by admin to disable bridging)
Default is false (unpaused)

fields.name: daily_cap
docs: Daily cap in token units (0 = no cap)

fields.name: daily_volume
docs: Current daily volume (resets at midnight UTC)

fields.name: last_reset
docs: Last reset timestamp

fields.name: min_amount
docs: Minimum amount per transaction (0 = no minimum)

fields.name: max_amount
docs: Maximum amount per transaction (0 = no maximum)

fields.name: bump
docs: Bump seed for PDA derivation

fields.name: flat_fee_amount
docs: Flat fee in token units (charged per bridge-out operation)

fields.name: percentage_fee_bps
docs: Percentage fee in basis points (e.g., 30 = 0.30%)

fields.name: fee_collector_ata
docs: Token account to receive fees (ATA for this token)

fields.name: whale_threshold
docs: Whale threshold - transfers >= this amount require delayed claim
0 = no whale delay

fields.name: whale_delay_seconds
docs: Delay in seconds for whale transfers

fields.name: _reserved
docs: Reserved space for future fields

types.name: Vault
docs: Token vault for holding locked SPL tokens
One vault per token mint

fields.name: token_mint
docs: Token mint this vault holds

fields.name: total_locked
docs: Total amount locked in vault

fields.name: bump
docs: Bump seed for PDA derivation
